text: The voiceless alveolar fricative is a type of consonant. The letter for this sound in the International Phonetic Alphabet is ⟨⟩. The X-SAMPA symbol for this sound is `⟨s⟩`. The English language has this sound, and it is the sound represented by 's' in sun and sorry. == Features == == Examples == Language Word IPA Meaning Adyghe Adyghe /sė 'I' Arabic Modern Standard /ǧalasa 'to sit' Assyrian ܣܝܦܐ 'sword' Bengali 'street' Burmese Burmese စစားဗျီ/ca carr bhye 'I am eating now' Chinese Cantonese / 'twinkle' Dutch Belgian Standard 'to stand' Emilian and Romagnol Emilian and Romagnol 'salt' Estonian Estonian 'word' English English sit 'sit' Esperanto 'Who hopes' Faroese Faroese 'sand' Georgian Georgian /sami 'three' Hebrew Hebrew /sefer 'book' Hindustani Hindustani / 'year' Japanese Japanese / 'plural' Kabardian Kabardian /sė 'I' Khmer / noun: 'Spain' adjective: 'Spanish' Korean Korean / 'island' Malay Malay 'one' Maltese Maltese 'hard' Marathi Marathi 'snake' Nepali 'Mount Everest' Odia 'equal' Occitan Limousin 'bad' Persian Persian / 'apple' Portuguese Portuguese 'I hunt' Punjabi Punjabi /sapp 'snake' Spanish Latin American 'jumper' Spanish Canarian 'jumper' Spanish Andalusian 'jumper' Spanish Filipino 'jumper' Swahili Swahili 'Swahili' Sylheti Sylheti /oise 'done' Vietnamese Vietnamese 'far' Yi Yi 'die' ==Notes== ==References== * * * * * * * Category:Consonants
title: Voiceless alveolar fricative
